verbs.description: encapsulate (third-person singular simple present encapsulates, present participle encapsulating, simple past and past participle encapsulated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To enclose something in, or as if in, a capsule.
examples: At a rate of six inches a year, the salt closes in on the waste and encapsulates it for what engineers say will be millions of years.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To epitomize something by expressing it as a brief summary.
(software, object-oriented programming) To enclose objects in a common interface in a way that makes them interchangeable, and guards their states from invalid changes.
(networking) To enclose data in packets that can be transmitted using a given protocol.
